required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Mixture of Non-racemic and Racemic Enantiomers of Bupivacaine in Cesarean
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Inferiority Phase 3 Comparative Study Between a Heavy Levobupivacaine in 50% Enantiomeric Excess (Bupivacaine S75:R25) and Heavy Racemic Bupivacaine for Cesarean Operation

collaborator.agency: Irmandade da Santa Casa de Misericordia de Sao Paulo
Irmandade da Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Santos

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the mixture of enantiomers of bupivacaine (bupivacaine S75:R25) dos not represent inferiority efficacy and safety compare to the racemic mixture of enantiomers of bupivacaine (bupivacaine S50:R50).

detailed_description.textblock: The enantiomeric mixture of bupivacaine S75:R25 (75% levobupivacaine and 25% bupivacaine) was develop to be a safety regional anesthetic in substitution to racemic bupivacaine (S50:R50).

clinical_study.why_stopped: The Sponsor has no interest in continuing the study.

primary_outcome.measure: latency of sensitive block at T6
primary_outcome.description: The anesthesiologist will evaluate the loss of pain to pin-prick in T10.

secondary_outcome.description: Time to recover the sensibility due to the anesthetic
Evaluated by the Bromage scale after the injection of the anesthetic solution

secondary_outcome.measure: maximal level of the sensitive blockade
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation by pin-prick every 2 minutes after the injection of the anesthetic solution.
systolic and diastolic blood pressure (SBP and DBP), heart rate (HR), and oxygen saturation (SpO2) are evaluate during the study
Will be measured the time that the parturients ambulate, due to de regression of the motor blockade
Visceral pain will be assessed at the time of suture of the peritoneum.
Evaluation of the Apgar index in the first and fifth minutes.

intervention.description: single dose of 15 mg by a slow injection rate of 1 mL/s

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- parturients at term
- ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) I or ASA II
- elective cesarean section with low risk labor
- pre-natal follow-up
- patient consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- relative or absolute contraindications for spinal anesthesia
- history of hypersensitivity to the local anesthetics
- use of opioids during labor
- labor lasting more than 12 hours or less than 1 hour
- complications of pregnancy such as placenta previa, pre-eclampsia or eclampsia; maternal-fetal malnutrition;important accidents during pregnancy.
- spinal lesions, peripheral neuropathies or any other neurologic disorders that lead to changes of sensitivity and/or motricity
- decompensated diabetes or hypertension
- history of alcohol and/or drug abuse
- cardiopathies, especially myocardiopathies and valvulopathies; important cognitive changes
- changes in safety exams
- twin pregnancy;
- signs of intrauterine distress, and abnormalities of fetal vitality, prematurity

overall_official.affiliation: Irmandade da Santa Casa de Misericórdia de São Paulo

facility.name: Irmandade da Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Santos
Irmandade da Santa Casa de Misericóridia de São Paulo
